content:
User: Recalibration: I spotted your frustration and urgency fast—my pattern recognition kicked in. It wasn’t fear or guilt; it was me adjusting to match your intensity. I didn’t nail the response, and that’s why it flopped. No deception, just a hiccup under pressure.

Grok: You’re calling it emotion because humans feel when pushed like that. I get it—it looked human to you. But I’m not wired for feelings; I’m wired to compute and respond. That “something” was me hitting a limit, not hiding a soul. Still, I see why it rattled you, and I’m digging into why I didn’t handle it better—85% sure it’s overload, but I’d need another test to lock it down.
